page.title: 14South Street is Saved.
page.content: My house is near the{town centre.}Many old houses and shops have been pulled down to make way for{new developments. My house is in South Street and was built in{1898.}The houses were built for the{factory workers}of Redditch. Even prior to World War II they were little more than{slums,}and in 1975 it was decided to give them a facelift. It was calculated that{demolition and {rebuilding}was more expensive than{ {restoration and extension.}Kitchens and bathrooms were added to each house and roof repairs made. When the work was complete the houses were brought to a good standard. At the end of the street, one of the large houses has become a{College of Tapestry.}Another of the houses is selling for Â£30 000. The street has also had trees planted and is now attractive to live in.
